title: Items vertical slice (epic)
description:
First vertical slice: build Items content type end-to-end.

This validates the entire authoring pipeline from editor to runtime.

Components:
1. Schema: Item table in SQLite, Rust struct
2. Editor UI: Form for item CRUD (bevy_egui)
3. Editor API: REST endpoints for items (axum)
4. Data Pipeline: Load items from SQLite, hot-reload on change
5. Runtime: Spawn items, pickup handling, effect application
6. Verification: Tests for authoring workflow

Completion criteria:
- User can define item in editor
- Item spawns in game with correct properties
- Changes to item hot-reload
- Item definition persists across restarts

See: docs/build-order.md Phase 2

title: Items vertical slice tests
description:
End-to-end tests proving the Items authoring workflow works.

Tests:
1. Create item via API -> item appears in DB
2. Load item from DB -> registry has item
3. Spawn item in world -> entity exists with correct components
4. Modify item in DB -> hot-reload updates registry
5. Full flow: create in editor -> spawns correctly in game

Crate: roguebench-engine (integration tests)
Depends on: All Items slice components

title: Set up workspace crate structure
description:
Create the multi-crate workspace structure per docs/stack.md:

- roguebench-core: Platform-agnostic types (no Bevy)
- roguebench-protocol: Network protocol, shared components  
- roguebench-engine: Bevy plugins and systems
- roguebench-editor: Web editor backend (axum)
- roguebench-client: Game client binary
- roguebench-server: Game server binary

Also set up:
- Workspace Cargo.toml with all crates
- Basic lib.rs/main.rs for each crate
- Bevy 0.17+ dependency in engine crate
- SQLite (rusqlite) dependency in relevant crates

title: Item data loader and registry
description:
Load items from SQLite into runtime registry.

- Connect to SQLite database
- Query items table
- Deserialize item definitions  
- Store in Bevy resource (ItemRegistry)
- Support hot-reload (detect DB changes, reload)

Crate: roguebench-engine
Depends on: Item schema

title: Item editor UI (bevy_egui)
description:
Form-based UI for creating and editing items.

Features:
- List view of all items
- Create new item form
- Edit existing item form
- Delete confirmation
- Validation feedback
- Save/cancel actions

Keep it functional, not fancy:
- Forms over canvases
- Text fields over drag handles
- Clear error messages

Crate: roguebench-engine (or editor)
Depends on: Item editor API

title: Item schema and SQLite table
description:
Define the Item data model and create SQLite schema.

Rust struct:
```rust
#[derive(Debug, Serialize, Deserialize)]
struct ItemDefinition {
    name: String,
    item_type: ItemType,
    description: Option<String>,
    effects: Vec<Effect>,
    // ... other fields
}
```

SQLite table:
```sql
CREATE TABLE items (
    id TEXT PRIMARY KEY,
    name TEXT NOT NULL,
    item_type TEXT NOT NULL,
    data BLOB NOT NULL,
    created_at INTEGER NOT NULL,
    updated_at INTEGER NOT NULL
);
```

Crate: roguebench-core (types) + roguebench-engine (schema)
Part of: Items vertical slice

title: Item editor API (axum)
description:
REST API for item CRUD operations.

Endpoints:
- GET /api/items - List all items
- GET /api/items/:id - Get specific item
- POST /api/items - Create item
- PUT /api/items/:id - Update item  
- DELETE /api/items/:id - Delete item
- POST /api/validate/item - Validate without saving

Response format: JSON
Storage: SQLite (direct writes)

Crate: roguebench-editor
Depends on: Item schema

title: Item runtime spawning
description:
Spawn items in game world from definitions.

- Spawn item entity from ItemDefinition
- Set up sprite/visuals
- Add pickup collision
- Handle pickup interaction
- Apply item effects on use

Components needed:
- Item (marker)
- Pickup (collision trigger)
- ItemEffects (what happens on use)

Crate: roguebench-engine
Depends on: Item data loader
